page.title: 03SALMONHUTCH AND UTON.
page.content: We left Landscore about 1.20pm for Salmonhutch.Salmonhutch is about 2km away from school. Salmonhutch consists of a bridge,the River Yeo and a few cottages next to the railway line.It used to be where salmon hatched out _ hence the name _ we think!The 8 cottages were semi_ detached and all had slate roofs. The river was shallow at this stage and fairly slow running.This was because we hadn't had much rain.We went over a stile down to the river edge to explore.We saw lots of wildlife and wildflowers.In the river we saw pond skaters,water spiders and minnows.Some of the flowers included cow parsley,stitchwort,garlic mustard as well as the usual field flowers like buttercups and daisies.We saw a few birds- pigeons and a finch.
